pageTitle: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau speaks with British Columbia Premier John Horgan | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Today, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau spoke with British Columbia Premier John Horgan to discuss shared priorities. The Prime Minister reaffirmed his commitment to work collaboratively with Premier Horgan and the Government of British Columbia. He also congratulated Premier Horgan on the adoption of the Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples Act and thanked him for his leadership in this area.

The Prime Minister and the Premier affirmed their shared commitment to ongoing bilateral work on the electrification of the natural gas sector.

The Prime Minister and Premier Horgan also discussed ongoing collaboration on a wide range of issues, notably fisheries issues on the West Coast, and the importance of investments in health care, including pharmacare and mental health.

They agreed to continue to collaborate on these priorities, and looked forward to the next First Ministersâ€™ Meeting.
